abstract: As frequent international business travelers can attest, mobile phones have shrunk the distance between land masses, making it like prehistoric times when all the continents touched. Only, now there’s a better signal.

lead_paragraph: I REMEMBER standing in line at the post office in Florence in 1982, waiting with my parents to get into a phone booth to call the United States.

headline.main: Doing Away With Far and Away
